controls.title: Ensure X Window System is not installed
controls.description: The X Window System provides a Graphical User Interface (GUI) where users can have multiple windows in which to run programs and various add on. The X Windows system is typically used on workstations where users login, but not on servers where users typically do not login.
controls.remediation: Remove X Windows: yum remove xorg-x11-server-common

controls.title: Ensure Avahi Server is not installed
controls.description: Avahi is a free zeroconf implementation, including a system for multicast DNS/DNS-SD service discovery. Avahi allows programs to publish and discover services and hosts running on a local network with no specific configuration.

controls.title: Ensure CUPS is not installed
controls.description: The Common Unix Print System (CUPS) provides the ability to print to both local and network printers. A system running CUPS can also accept print jobs from remote systems and print them to local printers.

controls.title: Ensure DHCP Server is not installed
controls.description: The Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) is a service that allows machines to be dynamically assigned IP addresses.
controls.remediation: Remove DHCP Server: yum remove dhcp-server

controls.title: Ensure DNS Server is not installed
controls.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) is a hierarchical naming system that maps names to IP addresses for computers, services and other resources connected to a network.
controls.remediation: Remove DNS Server: yum remove bind

controls.title: Ensure FTP Server is not installed
controls.description: The File Transfer Protocol (FTP) provides networked computers with the ability to transfer files.
controls.remediation: Remove FTP Server: yum remove vsftpd

controls.title: Ensure HTTP server is not installed
controls.description: HTTP or web servers provide the ability to host web site content.
controls.remediation: Remove HTTP Server: yum remove httpd

controls.title: Ensure IMAP and POP3 server is not installed
controls.description: dovecot is an open source IMAP and POP3 server for Linux based systems.

controls.title: Ensure Samba is not installed
controls.description: The Samba daemon allows system administrators to configure their Linux systems to share file systems and directories with Windows desktops.

controls.title: Ensure HTTP Proxy Server is not installed
controls.description: Squid is a standard proxy server used in many distributions and environments.

controls.title: Ensure net-snmp is not installed
controls.description: The Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) server is used to listen for SNMP commands from an SNMP management system, execute the commands or collect the information and then send results back to the requesting system.

controls.title: Ensure NIS Server is not installed
controls.description: The Network Information Service (NIS) (formerly known as Yellow Pages) is a client-server directory service protocol for distributing system configuration files.
controls.remediation: Remove NIS Server: yum remove ypserv

controls.title: Ensure telnet-server is not installed
controls.description: The telnet-server package contains the telnet daemon, which accepts connections from users from other systems via the telnet protocol.

controls.title: Ensure mail transfer agent is configured for local-only mode
controls.description: Mail Transfer Agents (MTA), such as sendmail and Postfix, are used to listen for incoming mail and transfer the messages to the appropriate user or mail server.
controls.remediation: Configure MTA to listen only on localhost: Edit /etc/postfix/main.cf and set inet_interfaces = loopback-only

controls.title: Ensure rsync service is not installed
controls.description: The rsync service can be used to synchronize files between systems over network links.
